com.martinandersson.javaee.resources

Enum SchemaGenerationStrategy

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Enum<SchemaGenerationStrategy>
      • com.martinandersson.javaee.resources.SchemaGenerationStrategy
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable, Comparable<SchemaGenerationStrategy>

    public enum SchemaGenerationStrategy
extends Enum<SchemaGenerationStrategy>
    Strategy for database schema generation.

    Available strategies:

    • UPDATE
    • DROP_CREATE
    Author:
    Martin Andersson (webmaster at martinandersson.com)
    See Also:
    com.martinandersson.javaee.utils.Deployments#buildPersistenceArchive(SchemaGenerationStrategy, Class, Class...)

    • Enum Constant Summary

      Enum Constants 
      Enum Constant and Description
      DROP_CREATE
      All tables will be 1) dropped and then 2) created.
      UPDATE
      All tables will be 1) created if not present or 2) used if already present and 3) updated if need be.

    • Enum Constant Detail

      • UPDATE

        public static final SchemaGenerationStrategy UPDATE
        All tables will be 1) created if not present or 2) used if already present and 3) updated if need be.

        This strategy work homogenously on EclipseLink as well as Hibernate.

        Using this strategy will make file ./src/test/resources/persistence-update.xml be deployed in the test archive as META-INF/persistence.xml.

      • DROP_CREATE

        public static final SchemaGenerationStrategy DROP_CREATE
        All tables will be 1) dropped and then 2) created.

        WildFly that uses Hibernate has a third side-effect: Hibernate drop the tables after the test. Meaning that you cannot explore the tables and data in them after the test is done. If that is what you want, then use GlassFish/EclipseLink.

        Using this strategy will make file ./src/test/resources/persistence-dropcreate.xml be deployed in the test archive as META-INF/persistence.xml.
